def prime_factors(n) 
    factors = [] of Int32
    i = 2
    while (i * i <= n)
        while (n % i == 0)
            factors << i
            n /= i
        end
        i += 1
    end
    if (n > 1) 
    	factors << n 
  	end
    factors.size
end
def count_Kprimes(k, start, nd)
    kprimes = [] of Int32
    i = start
    while (i <= nd)
        if (prime_factors(i) == k)
      		kprimes << i 
    	end
        i += 1
    end
    kprimes
end
def puzzle(s)
    a = count_Kprimes(1, 0, s)
    b = count_Kprimes(3, 0, s)
    c = count_Kprimes(7, 0, s)
    cnt = 0; ia = 0
    while (ia < a.size)
        ib = 0
        while (ib < b.size)
            ic = 0
            while (ic < c.size)
                if (a[ia] + b[ib] + c[ic] == s)
                    cnt += 1
                end
                ic += 1
            end
            ib += 1
        end
        ia += 1
    end
    cnt
end

def count_Kprimes(k, start, nd)
  ys=[] of Int32
  n=start
  while (n<=nd)
    j=pfc(n)
    if (j==k)
      ys<<n
    end
    n=n+1
  end
  ys
end
def puzzle(s)
  m=0
  xs=count_Kprimes(7,128,s-2)
  xs.each{|a|
    ys=count_Kprimes(3,4,s-a)
    ys.each{|b|
      c=s-a-b
      if (c>0&&pfc(c)==1)
        m=m+1
      end
    }
  }
  m
end
def pfc(n)
  j=0
  i=2
  while (i<=n/i)
    while (n%i==0)
      j=j+1
      n=n/i
    end
    i=i+1
  end
  if (n>1)
    j=j+1
  end
  j
end

def count_factors(n)
  c = 0
  while n&1 == 0
    c += 1
    n >>= 1
  end
  i = 3
  while i**2 <= n
    while n%i == 0
      c += 1
      n /= i
    end
    i += 1
  end
  c + (n > 1 ? 1 : 0)
end

def count_Kprimes(k, start, nd)
  (Math.max(start, 2**k)..nd).reject {|i| count_factors(i) != k}.to_a
end

def puzzle(s)
  a = [] of Int32
  b = [] of Int32
  c = [] of Int32
  (2..s-10).each do |i|
    case count_factors(i)
    when 1
      a << i
    when 3
      b << i
    when 7
      c << i
    end
  end
  n = 0
  i = 0
  while i < a.size
    j = 0
    while a[i] + b[j] <= s - (2**7)
      ab = a[i] + b[j]
      k = c.size-1
      while true
        case ab + c[k] <=> s
        when 0
          n += 1
          break
        when -1
          break
        end
        k -= 1
      end
      j += 1
    end
    i += 1
  end
  n
end

def k_of(n)
  return 0 if n < 2
  k = 0
  m = n
  while m % 2 == 0
    m /= 2
    k += 1
  end
  (3..Math.sqrt(n)).each do |i|
    while m % i == 0
      m /= i
      k += 1
    end
  end
  k += 1 if m != 1
  k
end
def count_Kprimes(k, start, stop)
  result = [] of Int32
  (start..stop).each do |i|
    result << i if k_of(i) == k
  end
  result
end
def puzzle(n)
  _as = [] of Int32
  _bs = [] of Int32
  _cs = [] of Int32
  (2..n).each do |i|
    k_of_i = k_of(i)
    if k_of_i == 1
      _as << i
    elsif k_of_i == 3
      _bs << i
    elsif k_of_i == 7
      _cs << i
    end
  end
  result = 0
  _as.each do |a|
    _bs.each do |b|
      _cs.each do |c|
        result += 1 if a + b + c == n
      end
    end
  end
  result
end

def nb_divisors(n)
  nb = 0
  d = 2
  while d <= n
    if n % d == 0
      nb += 1
      n = n / d
    else
      d += 1
    end
  end
  nb
end

def is_k_prime(n, k)
  nb_divisors(n) == k
end

def count_Kprimes(k, start, nd)
  puts "count_Kprimes(#{k}, #{start}, #{nd})"
  (start..nd).select do |n|
    is_k_prime(n, k)
  end
end

def puzzle(s)
  puts "puzzle(#{s})"
  k1 = (2..s).select { |n| is_k_prime(n, 1) }
  k3 = (2..s).select { |n| is_k_prime(n, 3) }
  k7 = (2..s).select { |n| is_k_prime(n, 7) }
  nb = 0
  k1.each do |i1|
    k3.each do |i2|
      k7.each do |i3|
        nb += 1 if i1 + i2 + i3 == s
      end
    end
  end
  nb
end

def npf(n)
  m, i = 0, 2
  while n > 1
    if n%i == 0
      n = (n / i).to_i
      m += 1
      i = 1
    end
    i += 1
  end
  m
end

def smallest(n)
  str = n.to_s; smallest = str; result = [-1, -1, -1]; l = str.size
  str.split("").each_with_index do |ch, i|
      str1 = str[0...i] + str[i+1...l] 
      str.split("").each_index do |j|
      str2 = str1[0...j] + ch + str1[j...l]
      if (str2 < smallest)
        smallest = str2
        result = [smallest.to_i, i, j]
      end
    end
  end
  result[0] != -1 ? result : [n, 0, 0]
end

def smallest(n) 
  arr = n.to_s.chars.map(&.to_i)  
  results_list = Array(Array(Int32)).new
  arr[0..].each_with_index do |v, i|
    arr[0..].each_with_index do |w, j|
      arr2 = arr.dup
      arr2.delete_at(i)
      arr2.insert(j-1,v)
      results_list.push([arr2.join.to_i, i, j == 0 ? arr.size-1 : j-1])
    end  
  end
  return results_list.sort{ |a, b| a <=> b }[0]
end

def smallest(n)
  digits = n.to_s.chars
  (0..digits.size-1).reduce([n, -1, -1]){ |ac, from|
    (0..digits.size-1).reduce(ac) {|ac, to|
        smallest = replace(digits, from, to)
        smallest < ac[0] ? [smallest, from, to] : ac
    }
  }
end
def replace(digits, from, to)
    d = digits.dup
    digit = d.delete_at(from)
    d.insert(to, digit).join.to_i
end

def decompose_single_strand(single_strand)
  n = single_strand.size
  s =-> (i: Int32){"Frame #{i+1}: #{i>0? single_strand[...i]+" ": ""}"+
                   (0...n/3).map{|j| single_strand[j*3+i...j*3+i+3]}.join ' '}
  [s===0, s===1, s===2].join '
'
end

class DnaStrand
  def initialize(@representation : String)
  end

  def frame(frame_number : UInt8) : String
    String.build do |frame|
      @representation.each_char_with_index do |char, index|
        frame << char

        if (index < @representation.size - 1) & (index % 3 == (frame_number + 1) % 3)
          frame << ' '
        end
      end
    end
  end

  def frames
    frames = Hash(UInt8, String).new

    1_u8.upto(3) do |i|
      frames[i] = frame(i)
    end

    frames
  end
end

def decompose_single_strand(dna_strand_representation)
  DnaStrand.new(dna_strand_representation).frames.map do |key, value|
    "Frame #{key}: #{value}"
  end.join("
")
end

def decompose_single_strand(s)
  sz = s.size
  i1, i2, i3 = 0, 2, 1
  f1, f2, f3 = "", "", ""
  sz.times do |x|
    if i1 == 3
      f1 += ' '
      f1 += s[x]
      i1 = 0
    elsif
      f1 += s[x]
    end

    if i2 == 3
      f2 += ' '
      f2 += s[x]
      i2 = 0
    elsif
      f2 += s[x]
    end

    if i3 == 3
      f3 += ' '
      f3 += s[x]
      i3 = 0
    elsif
      f3 += s[x]
    end
    i1 += 1
    i2 += 1
    i3 += 1
  end
  "Frame 1: " + f1 + "
" +
  "Frame 2: " + f2 + "
" +
  "Frame 3: " + f3
end

def decompose_single_strand(single_strand)
  one = single_strand.chars.each_slice(3).map { |e| e.join }.join(" ")
  two = "#{single_strand[0]} #{single_strand[1..-1].chars.each_slice(3).map { |e| e.join }.join(" ")}"
  three = "#{single_strand[0..1]} #{single_strand[2..-1].chars.each_slice(3).map { |e| e.join }.join(" ")}"
  ["Frame 1: #{one}", "Frame 2: #{two}", "Frame 3: #{three}"].join("
")
end

def decompose_single_strand(s) (0..2).map{|i| "Frame #{i+1}: #{((i==0 ? [] of String : [s[0,i]])+s[i,s.size].scan(/.{1,3}/).map{|e| e[0]}).join(" ")}"}.join("
") end

57591ef494aba64d14000526.body:
def walk(n)
  xs = [0]
  ys = [1]
  i = 1
  while i < n
    x1 = xs[i - 1]
    x2 = ys[x1]
    xs.push(i - x2)
    y1 = ys[i - 1]
    y2 = xs[y1]
    ys.push(i - y2)
    i += 1
  end
  [ys, xs]
end

def john(n)
  walk(n)[1]
end
def ann(n)
  walk(n)[0]
end
def sum_john(n)
  john(n).reduce(0) { |acc, i| acc + i }  
end
def sum_ann(n)
  ann(n).reduce(0) { |acc, i| acc + i } 
end

def john(n)
  build_john([0], [1], n)
end

def build_john(john, ann, n)
  while n > john.size
    john = add_to_john(john, ann)
    ann = add_to_ann(ann, john)
  end
  john
end

def build_ann(ann, john, n)
  while n > ann.size
    john = add_to_john(john, ann)
    ann = add_to_ann(ann, john)
  end
  ann
end

def add_to_john(john, ann)
  t = john[john.size - 1]
  john << (john.size - ann[t])
  john
end

def add_to_ann(ann, john)
  t = ann.last
  ann << (ann.size - john[t])
  ann
end

def ann(n)
  build_ann([1], [0], n)
end

def sum_john(n)
  john(n).sum
end

def sum_ann(n)
  ann(n).sum
end

def john(n)
  j, _a = ja(n, 0, {} of Int32 => Int32, {} of Int32 => Int32)
  j
end

def ann(n)
  _j, a = ja(n, 0, {} of Int32 => Int32, {} of Int32 => Int32)
  a
end

def sum_john(n)
  john(n).sum
end

def sum_ann(n)
  ann(n).sum
end

def ja(n, cur, j, a)
  if cur == n
    {j.values, a.values}
  elsif cur == 0
    ja(n, 1, {0 => 0}, {0 => 1})
  else
    hj = j[cur - 1]
    ha = a[cur - 1]
    j[cur] = cur - a[hj]
    a[cur] = cur - j[ha]
    ja(n, cur + 1, j, a)
  end
end

  res = [] of String
  (1..n_floors).each do |n|
      elements = (n * 2) - 1
      padding = ((width - elements) / 2).to_i
      res.push("#{" " * padding}" + "#{"*" * elements}" + "#{" " * padding}")
  end
  return res
end

def tower_builder(n_floors)

  (1..n_floors).map{|i|

    t = "".ljust(2 * i - 1, '*')
    ans << s + t + s
  }

def tower_builder(n)
  w = n * 2 - 1
  (1..n).map do |l|
    res = Array(Char).new(w, ' ')
    v = l * 2 - 1   
    res.fill('*', (w - v) >> 1, v).join
   end

def tower_builder(n_floors)
  n = n_floors
  element = "*"  
  while n > 1
    element = " #{element} "
    n -= 1
  end
  array = [] of String
  while n_floors >= 1
    array << element
    if n_floors > 1
      element = element.sub(n_floors - 2, "*")
      element = element.sub("* ", "**")
    end   
    n_floors -= 1
  end
  return array
end

def u1(n)
    memu = [1, 1]
    i = 2
    while (i < n)
        memu << memu[i - memu[i - 1]] + memu[i - memu[i - 2]]
        i += 1
    end
    memu
end

def u(n)
    u1(n)[n - 1]
end

# n >= 3
def length_sup_u_k(n, k)
    u1(n).select { |elem| elem >= k }.size
end

def comp(n)
    prev = 1; cnt = 0
    u1(n).each do |v| 
        cnt += 1 if v < prev 
        prev = v
    end
    cnt
end

def length_sup_u_k(n, k)
  sequence(n).select{ |x| x >= k }.size
end

def comp(n)
  seq = sequence(n)
  i = 1
  m = 0
  while i <= n
    if seq[i] < seq[i - 1]
      m += 1
    end
    i += 1
  end
  m
end

def sequence(n)
  seq = [] of Int64
  seq << 0
  seq << 1
  seq << 1
  i = 3
  while i <= n
    seq << seq[i - seq[i - 1]] + seq[i - seq[i - 2]]
    i += 1
  end
  seq
end

class Memo
  @@lookup = [0, 1, 1]
  def self.lookup
    @@lookup
  end
  def self.push(n)
    @@lookup << n
  end
end

def u(n)
  while Memo.lookup.size <= n
    Memo.push(Memo.lookup[-Memo.lookup[-1]] + Memo.lookup[-Memo.lookup[-2]])
  end
  Memo.lookup[n]
end

def length_sup_u_k(n, k)
  result = 0
  n.times do |i|
    result += 1 if u(i + 1) >= k
  end
  result
end
def comp(n)
  result = 0
  (n - 1).times do |i|
    result += 1 if u(i + 2) < u(i + 1)
  end
  result
end

  if height == ph1

def time_correct(t)
  if t.nil? || t.blank?
    return t
  end

  time_parts = t.split(":").map(&.to_i?)

  if time_parts.size != 3 || time_parts.any?(&.nil?)
    return
  end

  hours, minutes, seconds = time_parts.compact

  # creating timespan takes care of seconds/minutes overflowing >60 and hours > 24
  ts = Time::Span.new(hours, minutes, seconds)

  # format in requested format only hh:mm:ss (no days)
  "%02d:%02d:%02d" % {ts.hours, ts.minutes, ts.seconds}
end

def time_correct(t)
 
  if t.nil? || t.size == 0
    return t
  end

  # items = t.split ":" # t.try &.split(":")
  hour_parts = [] of Int32

def time_correct(t)
  return nil if t == nil    # nil arg passed
  
  time : String = t.to_s    #force string
  return "" if time.empty?  #empty string passed
  
  parsed = parse_time(time)
  return nil if parsed.empty?   # invalid format
  
  sec = parsed[0]*60*60 + parsed[1]*60 + parsed[2]
  
  s = sec % 60
  sec = sec / 60
  m = sec % 60
  sec = sec / 60
  h = sec % 24
  
  h.to_s.rjust(2, '0') + ':' + m.to_s.rjust(2, '0') + ':' + s.to_s.rjust(2, '0')
end

def parse_time(t : String) : Array(Int32)
  r = /^(\d\d):(\d\d):(\d\d)$/.match(t)
  return [] of Int32 if r == nil
  return [r.not_nil![1].to_i, r.not_nil![2].to_i, r.not_nil![3].to_i]
end

TIME_FORMAT     = /^(\d\d):(\d\d):(\d\d)$/
HOUR_DURATION   = 24
MINUTE_DURATION = 60
SECOND_DURATION = 60

def time_correct(t)
  return nil if t.nil?
  return "" if t.blank?
  
  if parts = TIME_FORMAT.match(t)
    hours, minutes, seconds = parts[1].to_i, parts[2].to_i, parts[3].to_i
    
    while seconds >= SECOND_DURATION
      minutes += 1
      seconds -= SECOND_DURATION
    end
    
    while minutes >= MINUTE_DURATION
      hours += 1
      minutes -= MINUTE_DURATION
    end
    
    while hours >= HOUR_DURATION
      hours -= HOUR_DURATION
    end
    
    [hours, minutes, seconds].map(&.to_s).map(&.rjust(2,'0')).join(":")
  end
end

def time_correct(t)

  if t.nil? 
    return nil
    
  elsif t==""
    return ""
    
  elsif t.size != 8
    return nil
    
  end
  
  numbers = [0, 1, 3, 4, 6, 7]

  (0..t.size-1).each do |i|
    if numbers.includes? i
      return nil if /[0-9]/.match("#{t[i]}") == nil
      
    else
      return nil if t[i] != ':'
      
    end
  end

  sec = (t[6].to_i()*10)+ t[7].to_i()
  sec_to_min = 0
  
  if sec >= 60
    sec_to_min = sec/60
    sec = sec%60
  end
  
  if sec < 10
    sec = "0#{sec}"
  end
  
  min = t[3].to_i()*10 + t[4].to_i() + sec_to_min
  min_to_hour = 0
  
  if min >= 60
    min_to_hour = min/60
    min = min%60
  end
  
  if min < 10
    min = "0#{min}"
  end
  
  hour = t[0].to_i()*10 + t[1].to_i() + min_to_hour
  
  if hour >= 24
    hour = hour%24
  end
  
  if hour < 10
    hour = "0#{hour}"
  end
  
  return "#{hour}:#{min}:#{sec}"

end

    if n % i == 0
      return false
    end
  end
  n > 1
end

def goldbach_partitions(n)
  lst = [] of String
  if n.odd?
    return [] of String
  end
  (2..n / 2).each do |i|
    if prime(i) && prime(n - i)
      lst << "#{i}+#{n-i}"
    end
  end
  lst
end

require "math"

NUMBER_OF_PRIMES = 100000
PRIMES = [2]
test_number = 3
primes_found = 1

while primes_found < NUMBER_OF_PRIMES
  test_primitiveness = true
  i = 0
  while (PRIMES.size > i && PRIMES[i] <= Math.sqrt(test_number) && test_primitiveness)
    if test_number % PRIMES[i] == 0
      test_primitiveness = false
    end
    i += 1
  end
  if test_primitiveness
    PRIMES << test_number
    primes_found += 1
  end
  test_number += 1
end

def goldbach_partitions(n)
  return [] of String if n.odd?
  
  primes = PRIMES.take_while { |p| p < n }
  result = [] of String
  
  primes.repeated_combinations(2).each do |comb|
    a, b = comb[0], comb[1]
    result << "#{a}+#{b}" if a + b == n
  end
  
  result
end

include Math

def goldbach_partitions(n)
  ans = [] of String
  if n % 2 != 0
    return ans
  else
    i = 0
    while i <= n / 2
      if is_prime(i) && is_prime(n - i)
        ans << "#{i}+#{n - i}"
      end
      i += 1
    end
    return ans
  end
end

def is_prime(n)
  i = 2
  if n == i
    return true
  end
  while i <= Math.sqrt(n) + 1
    if n % i == 0
      return false
    end
    i += 1
  end
  n > 1
end

def prime(a)
  if a == 2
    true
  elsif a <= 1 || a % 2 == 0
    false
  else
    divisors = (3..Math.sqrt(a)).step(2)
    divisors.none? { |d| a % d == 0 }
  end
end
def goldbach_partitions(n)
    if (n < 4 || n % 2 != 0)
        return [] of String
    end
    if (n == 4)
        return ["2+2"]
    end
    res = [] of String
    x = 3
    while true
        y = n-x
        if x > y 
            return res
        end
        if prime(y)
            res << (x.to_s + '+' + y.to_s)
        end
        x += 2
        while (! prime(x))
            x += 2
        end
    end
end

end

57cf3dad05c186ba22000348.body:
def decode_resistor_colors(bands)
  c = ["black", "brown", "red", "orange", "yellow", "green", "blue", "violet", "gray", "white", "silver", "gold"]
  r = bands.split.map{|w|c.index(w).not_nil!}
  v = (r[0]*10+r[1])*10**r[2]
  s = v>=1000000 ? v%1000000==0 ? "#{v/1000000}M" : "#{v/1000000.0}M" : v>=1000 ? v%1000==0 ? "#{v/1000}k" : "#{v/1000.0}k" : v
  return r.size>3 ? r[3] == 10 ? "#{s} ohms, 10%" : "#{s} ohms, 5%" : "#{s} ohms, 20%"
end

def decode_resistor_colors(bands)
  code  = %w[black brown red orange yellow green blue violet gray white]
  bands = bands.split
  res = "#{code.index(bands[0])}#{code.index(bands[1])}".to_i * (10 ** (code.index(bands[2]) || 0 ))
  per = bands.size > 3 ? bands[3] == "gold" ? "5%" : "10%" : "20%"

  if res < 1_000
    "#{res} ohms, #{per}"
  elsif res < 1_000_000
    r = (res / 1_000.0).round(5)
    r = r.to_i if r == r.to_i
    "#{r}k ohms, #{per}"
  else
    r = (res / 1_000_000.0).round(6)
    r = r.to_i if r == r.to_i
    "#{r}M ohms, #{per}"
  end
end

def index(colour)
  cc = %w[black brown red orange yellow green blue violet gray white]
  cc.index(colour) || 0
end

def decode_resistor_colors(bands)
  ar = bands.split
  ohms = index(ar[0]) * 10 + index(ar[1])
  ohms *= 10 ** index(ar[2])
  tol = ar.size > 3 ? (ar[3] == "gold" ? 5 : 10) : 20
  ohms = if ohms >= 1000000
    tmp = ohms / 1000000.0
    (tmp.to_i == tmp ? tmp.to_i : tmp).to_s + 'M'
  elsif ohms >= 1000
    tmp = ohms / 1000.0
    (tmp.to_i == tmp ? tmp.to_i : tmp).to_s + 'k'
  else
    ohms.to_s
  end
  ohms + " ohms, " + tol.to_s + "%"
end

def decode_resistor_colors(bands)
    assoc = {
        "black" => 0, "brown" => 1, "red" => 2,
        "orange" => 3, "yellow" => 4, "green" => 5,
        "blue" => 6, "violet" => 7, "gray" => 8, "white" => 9,
        "gold" => -5, "silver" => -10
    }
    code = bands.split(" ").map { |w| assoc[w] }
    if code.size == 3
        code << -20
    end
    res = (code[0]*10 + code[1]) * 10**code[2]
    err = -code[3]
    if res >= 1_000_000
        pow = "M"
        res /= 1_000_000.0
    elsif res >= 1_000
        pow = "k"
        res /= 1_000.0
    else
        pow = ""
    end
    if res == res.to_i
        res = res.to_i
    end
    "#{res}#{pow} ohms, #{err}%"
end

enum Band
 Black
 Brown
 Red
 Orange
 Yellow
 Green
 Blue
 Violet
 Gray
 White
end

enum Tolerance
  Gold = 5
  Silver = 10
  None = 20
end

struct Int
  THOUSAND = 1000
  MILLION = 1_000_000
  def humanize
    case self
    when 0...THOUSAND
      to_s
    when THOUSAND...MILLION
      "%f".%(self / THOUSAND.to_f).sub(/\.?0+$/, "") + "k"
    when .>= MILLION
      "%f".%(self / MILLION.to_f).sub(/\.?0+$/, "") + "M"
    end
  end
end

def parse_bands(bands)
  _, bs, tol = bands.match(/^([\w\s]+?)(gold|silver|$)/).not_nil!
  arr = bs.strip.split
  exponent = Band.parse(arr.pop).value
  # this should be to_i64 but the tests require crazy overflow to work
  coefficient = arr.join {|e| Band.parse(e).value }.to_i
  tolerance = Tolerance.parse(tol.empty? ? "None" : tol).value
  [coefficient, exponent, tolerance]
end

def decode_resistor_colors(bands)
  coeff, exp, tol = parse_bands(bands)
  ohms = coeff.*(10**exp).humanize
  "%s ohms, %d%%" % [ohms, tol]
end

  w,a,n,t,ant = xs.size,0,0,0,0
  (0...w).each{|i|

      if c == 'a'

       elsif c == 'n'

def dead_ant_count(ants)
  return 0 if ants.nil?
  ara = 0
  arr = [] of Char
  (0..ants.size - 1).each do |x|
    case ants[x]
    when 'a'
      if x == ants.size - 1 || x == ants.size - 2
        arr << ants[x]
      else
        arr << ants[x] unless ants[x + 1] == 'n' && ants[x + 2] == 't'
      end
    when 'n' 
      if x == ants.size - 1 || x == 0
        arr << ants[x] 
      else
        arr << ants[x] unless ants[x + 1] == 't' && ants[x - 1] == 'a'
      end
    when 't' 
      if x < 2
        arr << ants[x] 
      else
        arr << ants[x] unless ants[x - 1] == 'n' && ants[x - 2] == 'a'
      end
    end 
  end
  arr.empty? ? ara : arr.map {|x| [x,arr.count(x)]}.to_h.each {|k,v| ara = v.as(Int32) if v.as(Int32) > ara}; ara
end

  total <= 3 ? total : "You need extra sleep"

  ys = ["cw", "cat", "dog", "movie"]
  xs.each{|x|
    m += 1 if ys.includes?(x)

  }

def how_much_coffee(events)
  e = events.map do |ev|
    case ev
    when "cat", "dog", "cw", "movie"
      1
    when "CAT", "DOG", "CW", "MOVIE"
      2
    else
      0
    end
  end.sum

    e
  end

def how_much_coffee(events)
  cnt = 0
  events.each do |event|
    next unless event =~ /^(cw|dog|cat|movie)$/i 
    cnt += 1 if event == event.downcase
    cnt += 2 if event == event.upcase
    return "You need extra sleep" if cnt > 3
  end
  cnt
end

  end
  
  count = 0
  c_events.each do |e|
    count += e.downcase == e ? 1 : 2
  end
  count > 3 ? "You need extra sleep" : count
end

def string_to_array(str)
  i = 0
  last_index = 0
  result = [] of String
  
  while i < str.size
    if str[i, 1] == " "
      result.push(str[last_index, i - last_index])
      last_index = i + 1
    end
    i += 1
  end

  result.push(str[last_index, i - last_index])
    
  return result
    
end

def sea_sick(sea)
  c = sea.scan(/_~/).size + sea.scan(/~_/).size
  c > sea.size * 0.2 ? "Throw Up" : "No Problem"
end

def sea_sick(s)
  xs = s.chars
  size = s.size
  t = 0.2
  peaks = 0
  prev = nil
  i = 0
  while i < size
    x = xs[i].to_s
    if (x == "~" && prev == "_") || (prev == "~" && x == "_")
      peaks = peaks + 1
    end
    if x == "_" || x == "~"
      prev = x
    end
    i = i + 1
  end
  if peaks.to_f / size <= t
    return "No Problem"
  else
    return "Throw Up"
  end
end

def cat_mouse(x,j)
  c = x.index('C')
  m = x.index('m')
  d = x.index('D')
  if c.nil?
    "boring without all three"
  elsif m.nil?
    "boring without all three"
  elsif d.nil?
    "boring without all three"
  elsif j < (c-m).abs
    "Escaped!"
  elsif (c < d && d < m) || (m < d && d < c)
    "Protected!"
  else
    "Caught!"
  end
end

def cat_mouse(x, j)
  c = x.index("C") || return "boring without all three"
  d = x.index("D") || return "boring without all three"
  m = x.index("m") || return "boring without all three"
  d -= c
  m -= c
  if m < 0
    m = -m
    d = -d
  end
  if m > j+1
    "Escaped!"
  elsif m > d && d > 0
    "Protected!"
  else
    "Caught!"
  end
end

def cat_mouse(x,j) c=x.index('C') || -1; m=x.index('m') || -1; d=x.index('D') || -1; (c==-1 || m==-1 || d==-1) ? "boring without all three" : (c-m).abs>j+1 ? "Escaped!" : ((c>d && d>m) || (m>d && d>c)) ? "Protected!" : "Caught!" end

  return [m, "Hobo!"]

def chmod_calculator(perm)
    u = translate(perm[:user]? || "---")
    g = translate(perm[:group]? || "---")
    o = translate(perm[:other]? || "---")
    "#{u}#{g}#{o}"
end

def translate(description)
    p = 7
    (0..2).each do |i|
        if description[2-i] == '-'
            p -= 2 ** i
        end
    end
    p
end

def chmod_calculator(perm)
  order  = [:user,:group,:other]
  weight = {"r" => 4, "w" => 2, "x" => 1, "-" => 0 } 
  octal_perm = ""
  
  order.each do |g|
    g_perm = perm.fetch(g, "---") 
    g_octal_perm = 0
    g_perm.split("").each do |x|
      g_octal_perm += weight[x]
    end
    octal_perm += g_octal_perm.to_s
  end
  
  octal_perm
end

def meeting(x, need)
    res = [] of Int32
    if (need == 0)
        return "Game On"
    end
    i = 0
    while i < x.size
        aux = 0
        if x[i][1].to_i > x[i][0].to_s.size
            aux = x[i][1].to_i - x[i][0].to_s.size
        end
        if need - aux < 0
            aux = need
        end
        need -= aux
        res << aux
        if need == 0
            return res
        end
        i += 1
    end
    if need > 0
        "Not enough!"
    end
end

def meeting(r, n, res=[] of Int32) e=r.size>0 ? [n,r[0][1].to_i>r[0][0].to_s.size ? r[0][1].to_i-r[0][0].to_s.size : 0].min : 0; n==0 ? (res.size==0 ? "Game On" : res) : r.size==0 ? "Not enough!" : meeting(r[1...r.size], n-e, res+[e]) end

    end

def calc(string)
  string.chars.reduce(0) { |sum, x| sum + x.ord.digits.count(7) } * 6
end

# stdlib PR 9383
struct Int
  def digits(base = 10) : Array(Int32)
    if base < 2
      raise ArgumentError.new("Invalid base #{base}")
    end

    if self < 0
      raise ArgumentError.new("Can't request digits of negative number")
    end

    if self == 0
      return [0]
    end

    num = self

    digits_count = (Math.log(self.to_f + 1) / Math.log(base)).ceil.to_i

    ary = Array(Int32).new(digits_count)
    while num != 0
      ary << num.remainder(base).to_i
      num = num.tdiv(base)
    end
    ary
  end
end

def calc(string)
  total1 = string.chars.map(&.ord).join.chars.map(&.to_i)
  total2 = total1.map(&.to_s.tr("7", "1").to_i)
  total1.sum - total2.sum
end

def calc(string)
  tab = ""
  tab2 = ""
  string.each_char do |x|
    tab += (x.ord).to_s
  end
  tab.each_char do |x|
    if x == '7'
      tab2 += '1'
    else
      tab2 += x
    end
  end
  somme1 = 0
  somme2 = 0
  tab.size.times do |i|
    somme1 += tab[i].to_i
    somme2 += tab2[i].to_i
  end
  return somme1 - somme2
end

57f8ff867a28db569e000c4a.body:
def kebabize(str)
  # Very inefficient, just for fun
  str.gsub(/\d+/,"").gsub(/[A-Z]/){"-#{$0.downcase}"}.sub(/\A\-+/,"")
end

def kebabize(str)
  res = [] of Char
  tmp = [] of Char
  
  (0...str.size).each do |i|
    chr = str[i]
    if chr.ascii_letter?
      if chr.ascii_lowercase?
        tmp << chr
      else
        res.concat(tmp)
        if res.size > 0
          res << '-'
        end
        tmp.clear
        tmp << chr.downcase
      end
    end
  end
  res.concat(tmp)
  res.join
end

def kebabize(str)
  (str.gsub do |c|
    case
    when c.uppercase?
      "-" + c.downcase
    when c.lowercase?
      c
    end
  end).lstrip "-"
end

def berserk_rater(synopsis)
  score = 0
  synopsis.each do |s|
    if s =~ /CG/i && s =~ /Clang/i
      score += 5
      next
    end
    score -= 2 if s =~ /cg/i
    score += 5 if s =~ /clang/i
    score -= 1 if s !~ /CG/i && s !~ /Clang/i
  end
  if score < 0 
    return "worstest episode ever"
  elsif score > 10 
    return "bestest episode ever"
  else
    return score.to_s
  end
end

def diamonds_and_toads(s, f)
  hash = { "ruby" => 0, "crystal" => 0, "python" => 0, "squirrel" => 0 }
  f == :good ?
    s.each_char { | i | 
      case i
        when 'r' then hash["ruby"]    += 1
        when 'R' then hash["ruby"]    += 2
        when 'c' then hash["crystal"] += 1
        when 'C' then hash["crystal"] += 2
      end
    }
  :
    s.each_char { | i | 
    case i
      when 'p' then hash["python"]    += 1
      when 'P' then hash["python"]    += 2
      when 's' then hash["squirrel"]  += 1
      when 'S' then hash["squirrel"]  += 2
    end
    }
  hash.select { | k, v | v != 0 }
end

def diamonds_and_toads(sentence, fairy) 
  to_find = [] of Hash(Symbol, String)
  if fairy == :good
    to_find = {r: "ruby",c: "crystal"}
  elsif fairy == :evil
    to_find = {p: "python",s: "squirrel"}
  else
    return "No valid fairy!"
  end
  count = {} of String => Int32
  to_find.each do |k,v|
    count[to_find[k]] = 1 * sentence.count(k.to_s) + 2 * sentence.count(k.to_s.upcase) 
  end
  count.delete_if {|k,v| v == 0}
  count
end

def diamonds_and_toads(s, f)
  hash = { "ruby" => 0, "crystal" => 0, "python" => 0, "squirrel" => 0 }
  f == :good ?
    s.each_char { | i | 
      case i
        when 'r' then hash["ruby"]    += 1
        when 'R' then hash["ruby"]    += 2
        when 'c' then hash["crystal"] += 1
        when 'C' then hash["crystal"] += 2
      end
    }
  :
    s.each_char { | i | 
    case i
      when 'p' then hash["python"]    += 1
      when 'P' then hash["python"]    += 2
      when 's' then hash["squirrel"]  += 1
      when 'S' then hash["squirrel"]  += 2
    end
    }
  hash.select { | k, v | (f == :good ? ["ruby", "crystal"] : ["python", "squirrel"]).includes?(k) }
end

def remove(s)
  m = /[!]+$/ =~ s
  m.nil? ? return s.delete("!") : return s.delete("!") + "!" * (s.size - m)
end

def remove(s)
    if s.includes?(s) == false
        return s
    else
        list = s.split(" ")
        i=0
        while i != list.size-1
            list[i] = list[i].delete("!")
            i=i+1    
        end

        list2 = list[list.size-1].split(//)
        i=list2.size-1
        count=0
        while i != 0
            if list2[i] == "!"
                count=count+1
            else
                break
            end
            i=i-1
        end
        list[list.size-1]= list[list.size-1].delete("!")+ "!"*count
        return list.join(" ")
    end
end

      e+=1

      q+=1
    end
  end

def  product(s)
  frequency = s.each_char.each_with_object(Hash(Symbol, Int32).new(0)) do |char, freq|
    freq[:ex] += 1 if char == '!'
    freq[:q] += 1 if char == '?'
  end
  
  frequency[:ex] * frequency[:q]
end

def product(s)
  x = 0
  y = 0
  s.chars.each do |c|
    x += 1 if c == '!'
    y += 1 if c == '?'
  end
  x * y
end

def  product(s)
  # could have done s.count('!') * s.count('?') but that will iterate s twice. we can do it with a single iteration
  e = 0
  q = 0
  s.chars.each do |ch|
    if ch == '!'
      e += 1
    elsif ch == '?'
      q += 1
    end
  end
  e * q
end

def  product(s)
  q = s.count("?")
  e = s.count("!")
  q*e
end

def product(s)
  q, e = 0, 0
  s.each_char do |char|
    if(char == '?')
      q += 1
    elsif(char == '!')
      e += 1
    end
  end
  q * e
end

    x = x == "z" ? "a" : (x == "Z" ? "A" : x[0].succ.to_s)
    x.matches?(/[aeiou]/i) ? x.upcase : x.downcase
  end
end

def changer(s)
  w = ""
  s.each_char{|c|
    if c.downcase.to_s.codepoint_at(0)>="a".codepoint_at(0) && c.downcase.to_s.codepoint_at(0)<="z".codepoint_at(0)
      d = ((c.downcase.to_s.codepoint_at(0)-96)%26+97).chr
      if "aeuio".includes?(d)
        w += d.upcase
      else
        w += d.downcase
      end
    else
      w += c
    end
  }
  w
end

def next_letter(c : Char) : Char
  return c unless c.ascii_letter?
  offset = c.ascii_lowercase? ? 97 : 65
  ((c.ord - offset + 1) % 26 + offset).chr
end

def change_case(c : Char) : Char
  case c
  when 'A', 'E', 'I', 'O', 'U', 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'
    c.upcase
  else
    c.downcase
  end
end

def changer(string : String) : String
  String.build do |str|
    string.chars.each { |c| str << change_case(next_letter(c)) }
  end
end

def changer(string)
  changed = ""
  string.chars.each do |c|
    if !c.letter?
      changed += c
    elsif "zZ".includes? c
      changed += 'A'
    elsif "aeiou".includes? c.downcase.succ
      changed += c.succ.upcase
    else
      changed += c.succ.downcase
    end
  end
  changed
end

def changer(string)
  string.chars.map(&.downcase).map{ |c|
    next c if !c.letter? 
    c = c == 'z' ? 'a' : c.succ
    c = c.upcase if c.in_set?("aeiou")
    c
  }.join
end

def changer(string)
  string.downcase.chars.map do |c|
    if c.ascii_letter?
      if c == 'z'
        c = 'a'
      else
        c = (c.ord + 1).chr
      end
      if ['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'].includes? c
        c = c.upcase
      end
      c
    else
      c
    end
  end.join
end

    if i&1==0
      m+=y[i].ord

    end

def cake(x, y)
    if x == 0
        return "That was close!"
    end
    res = 0; i = 0
    while (i < y.size)
        if (i % 2 == 0)
            res += y[i].ord
        else
            res += y[i].ord - 96
        end
        i += 1
    end

    end
    "That was close!"

    return 0
  end
  
  d = Int32.new(2)
  num = Int32.new(1)

    d += 1
  end
  res
end

def random_ints(n, total)
  r = Random.new
  arr = [] of Int32
  until arr.size == n - 1
    arr << r.rand(total - arr.sum)
  end
  arr.push(total - arr.sum)
end

def random_ints(n, total)
  arr = (1..n).to_a.fill { [0,1].sample } 
  while arr.sum < total 
    idx = (0...arr.size).to_a.sample
    arr[idx] += ((-arr[idx])..(total - arr.sum)).to_a.sample
  end
  arr
end

  l = text.split(' ').max_of &.size + 4
  String.build { |s| s << "*" * l + "
"; text.split(' ').each { |w| s << "* #{w.reverse}#{" " * (l - w.size - 3)}*
" }; s << "*" * l + "
" }.chomp
end

def mirror(text)
  split = text.split(" ").map!{|w| w.reverse}
  width = split.sort_by{|w| w.size}[-1].size + 4
  string = String::Builder.new
  string << "*" * width << "
"
  split.each{|w| string << "* " << w << " " * (width - 4 - w.size) << " *
"}
  string << "*" * width
  string.to_s
end

def mirror(text)
  max_len = 0;
  # Find the longest world
  text.split(/\s+/).each do |word|
    word_len = word.size
    if (word_len > max_len)
      max_len = word_len
    end
  end
  # Create the mirrored string
  max_len = max_len + 4
  mirrored = "*" * max_len + "
"
  text.split(/\s+/).each do |word|
    repeat_white = max_len  - 4 - word.size
    if (repeat_white < 0 ) 
      repeat_white = 0
    end
    mirrored += "* " + word.split("").reverse().join("") + " " * repeat_white + " *
"
  end
  mirrored += "*" * max_len
  mirrored
end

def add_fracs(*a)
  if a.empty?
    return ""
  end
  denom = a.map{|x| x.split("/")[1].to_i}.reduce(1){|a, b| a * b // a.gcd(b)}
  numer = a.map{|x| x.split("/")[0].to_i * (denom // x.split("/")[1].to_i)}.sum
  g = denom.gcd(numer)
  "#{numer // g}/#{denom // g}".gsub(/\/1$/, "")
end

def furthest_distance(arr, k)
  n = -1
  (0...arr.size).each do |i|
    (i + 1...arr.size).each do |j|
      if (arr[j] - arr[i]).abs >= k
        n = [n, j - i].max
      end
    end
  end
  n
end

def furthest_distance(arr, k)
  nl = [] of Int32
  (0...arr.size).each { | i |
    (0...arr.size).each { | j |
      if arr[i] - arr[j] >= k
        nl.push((i - j).abs)
      end
    }
  }
  nl.empty? ? -1 : nl.max
end

  return "snake" if s =~ /\A[a-z]+(_[a-z]+)*\z/

  return "snake" if (/^[a-z]+(_[a-z]+)+$/) === s

  return "none"
end

    return "snake"
  end
  if (/^([a-z]+[A-Z])+[a-z]+$/) === c_str
    return "camel"
  end
  return "none"
end

def decipher_this(string : String)
    string.split(" ").map { |el| swap(el.gsub(/\d+/, el.match(/\d+/).not_nil![0].to_i.chr), 1, -1) }.join(" ")
end

def swap(str, p1, p2)
    return str if str.size <= 2
    str_arr = str.chars
    tmp = str_arr[p1]
    str_arr[p1] = str_arr[p2]
    str_arr[p2] = tmp
    str_arr.join("")
end

def decipher_word(word)
  f = i = 0
  while i < word.size && ('0'..'9').includes?(word[i])
    f = f * 10 + word[i].ord - '0'.ord
    i += 1
  end
  f = f.chr.to_s
  case word.size
  when i
    f
  when i + 1
    f + word[i]
  else
    f + word[-1] + word[(i+1)..-2] + word[i]
  end
end

def decipher_this(string)
  string.split.map { |x| decipher_word(x) }.join ' '
end

def decipher_this(string)
  string.split.map do |word|
    cs = word.sub(/\d+/) { |digits| '\u{0}' + digits.to_i }.chars
    cs[1], cs[-1] = cs[-1], cs[1] if cs.size > 2
    cs.join
  end.join(' ')
end

def dashatize(num)
  return "" if num.nil?

  out_str = ""
  arr = num.abs.to_s.chars
  size = arr.size
  arr.each_with_index do |char, i|
    out_str += '-' if i - 1 >= 0 && arr[i-1].to_i.odd?
    out_str += char
    out_str += '-' if i + 1 < size && arr[i+1].to_i.odd?
  end

  return out_str.gsub("--","-")
end

def dashatize(num)
  if num == nil
    return ""
  end
  answer = ""
  num.to_s.chars.map { |c|
    if c != '-'
      if c.to_i % 2 == 1
        answer += "-" + c + "-"
      else
        answer += c
      end
    end
  }
  answer = answer.gsub "--", "-"
  offset_l = 0
  offset_r = answer.size - 1
  if answer[0] == '-'
    offset_l += 1
  end
  if answer[answer.size - 1] == '-'
    offset_r -= 1
  end
  answer[offset_l..offset_r]
end

print(dashatize(-1))

def dashatize(notnum)
  ""
end

def dashatize(num : Int32)
  num.abs.to_s.split("").reduce{ |a,b|
    if a[-1].to_i.odd? || b[0].to_i.odd?
      a + "-" + b
    else
      a + b
    end
  }
end

def dashatize(num)
    return "" if num.nil?
    str = [] of Char
    str_len = num.abs.to_s.size
    prev_dash = false
    num.abs.to_s.each_char_with_index do |char, index|
        n = char.to_i

        # Append a - if odd, not beginning of string, and no previous dash.
        if (n % 2 == 1 && index > 0 && prev_dash == false)
            str << '-'
        else
            prev_dash = false
        end
        
        str << char

        # Append a - if odd, not end of the string
        if (n % 2 == 1 && index < str_len - 1)
            str << '-' 
            prev_dash = true
        end
    end
    str.join
end

def predict(candidates, polls)
  hash = {} of (String | Char) => Float64
  
  candidates.each_with_index do |cand, idx|
    s = 0
    n = 0
    polls.each do |pl|
      s += pl[1].as(Int32 | Float64).to_f
      n += pl.as(Array)[0].as(Array)[idx].to_f * pl[1].as(Int32 | Float64)
    end
    hash[cand.as(String | Char)] = ((n / s).round(1)).as(Float64)
  end
  hash
end

def keep_order(ary, val)
  ary.each_with_index do |x, i|
     return i if x >= val
  end
  ary.size
end

def keep_order(a, val)
  if a.size < 1
    return 0
  end

  start = 0
  stop = a.size - 1
  
  while true
    if stop <= start
      if a[start] < val
        return start + 1
      else
        return start
      end
    end
      
    mid_index = (start + stop) // 2
    middle = a[mid_index]
  
    if middle < val
      start = mid_index + 1
    else
      stop = mid_index
    end
  end
end

def factors(n)
  sq, cb = [] of Int32, [] of Int32
  (2..n**0.5).each do |i|
    j = i*i; k = j*i
    sq<<i if n%j==0
    cb<<i if n%k==0
  end
  [sq, cb]
end

def factors(n)
  i = 2; j: Int32; k: Int32
  sq, cb = [] of Int32, [] of Int32
  while (j=i*i)<=n
    sq<<i if n%j==0
    k=j*i; cb<<i if k<=n && n%k==0
    i+=1
  end
  [sq, cb]
end

def factors(n)
  arr = [[] of Int32, [] of Int32]
  sq = [] of Int32
  cb = [] of Int32
  i = 2
  while i < n && i**2 != 0
    sq << i if n % i**2 == 0
    i += 1
  end
  i = 2
  while i < n && i**3 != 0
    cb << i if n % i**3 == 0
    i += 1
  end
  arr[0] = sq
  arr[1] = cb
  arr
end

def get_max_profit(stock_prices_yesterday)
  buy = -1.0 / 0.0
  sell = -1.0 / 0.0
  profit = -1.0 / 0.0
  stock_prices_yesterday[0...-1].each_with_index do |x, i|
    maxi = stock_prices_yesterday[i + 1..-1].max
    if maxi - x > profit
        buy = x
        sell = maxi
        profit = maxi - x
    end
  end
  [buy, sell, profit]
end

def get_max_profit(spy)
  r = Array(Array(Int32)).new
  spy[0..-2].each_with_index do |x, i|
    spy[i..-1].each do |y|
      r << [x, y, y-x]
    end
  end
  r.sort_by{|a| a.last}.last
end

def get_max_profit(stonks)
  s = stonks[-1]
  b = stonks[-2]
  g = [s,b].max
  (0...stonks.size-2).reverse_each do |i|
    c = stonks[i]
    if c > g
      g = c
    end
    if g-c > s-b
      b = c
      s = g
    end
  end
  [b, s, s-b]
end

def get_max_profit(stock_prices_yesterday)
  i = stock_prices_yesterday.first
  min, buy, sell, max_profit = i, i, i, 0
  stock_prices_yesterday.each do | sp |
    min = sp if sp < min
    profit = sp - min
    next unless profit > max_profit
    buy, sell, max_profit = min, sp, profit
  end
  [buy, sell, max_profit]
end

def elimination(arr)
  n = arr.size
  return nil if n==0 
  arr = arr.sort
  i, e1 = 0, arr[0]
  while (i+=1)<n 
    e2 = arr[i]
    return e1 if e1==e2
    e1 = e2
  end
  return nil
end

def elimination(arr)

    if arr.count(n) == 2
      return n
    end
  end
end

def elimination(arr : Enumerable(T)) : T? forall T
  arr.each_with_object(Set(T).new) do |x, seen|
    return x if seen.includes?(x)
    seen << x
  end
  nil
end

def combine_strings(*args)
  return "" if args.empty?
  arr = args.to_a.as?(Array(String))
  return "" if !arr
  length, pos = arr.max_of(&.size), 0
  str = String.build do |str|
    until pos == length
      arr.each do |word|
        letter = word[pos]?
        next if !letter
        str << letter
      end
      pos += 1
    end
  end
  str
end

def combine_strings(*args)  
  strings = args.to_a.map(&.chars.as(Array(Char)))
  combined_string = ""

  until strings.flatten.size == 0
    (0...strings.size).each { |i|
      combined_string += (strings[i].shift? || "")
    }
  end
  
  combined_string
end
def combine_strings(*f) m=f.reduce(0){|a,b|[a,b.size].max}; (0...m).map{|i| f.map{|a| i<a.size ? a[i] : ""}.join}.join end

def mormons(starting_number, reach, target)
  s, m = starting_number.to_u64, 0
  while s < target
    s *= 1 + reach
    m += 1
  end
  m
end

def mormons(starting_number, reach, target, times = 0)
	return times if starting_number >= target
	times += 1
	starting_number += starting_number * reach
	mormons(starting_number, reach, target, times)
end

def mormons(start, reach, target)
  return 0 if start >= target
  1 + mormons((reach * start) + start, reach, target)
end
def mormons(s, r, t) Math.log(t/s.to_f,r+1).ceil end

58397ee871df657929000209.body:
ACRONYMS = {
  "KPI"  => "key performance indicators",
  "EOD"  => "the end of the day",
  "TBD"  => "to be decided",
  "WAH"  => "work at home",
  "IAM"  => "in a meeting",
  "OOO"  => "out of office",
  "NRN"  => "no reply necessary",
  "CTA"  => "call to action",
  "SWOT" => "strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats"
}

def acronym_buster(message)
  message.split(".").map do |str|
    str = str.strip
    
    ACRONYMS.each do |key, value|
      str = str.gsub(/(?=\b)#{key}(?=\b)/, value) 
    end
    
    str.scan(/\b([A-Z]{3,})\b/).each do |match|
      return "#{match[0]} is an acronym. I do not like acronyms. Please remove them from your email."
    end
    
    str = str.gsub(/^(.)/) { |m| m.upcase }
    str
  end.join(". ").strip
end

def acronym_buster(s) s=s.gsub(/KPI/,"key performance indicators").gsub(/EOD/,"the end of the day").gsub(/TBD/,"to be decided").gsub(/WAH/,"work at home").gsub(/IAM/,"in a meeting").gsub(/OOO/,"out of office").gsub(/NRN/,"no reply necessary").gsub(/CTA/,"call to action").gsub(/SWOT/,"strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats"); ((" "+s)=~/\b[A-Z]{3,}\b/)!=nil ? "#{(" "+s).sub(/(.*)(\b[A-Z]{3,}\b)(.*)/,"\\2")} is an acronym. I do not like acronyms. Please remove them from your email." : s.split(". ").map{|a| a[0].upcase+a[1...a.size]}.join(". ") end

L=[]of Int32
def find_missing_letter(arr)
  L.push(1)  
  arr=arr.map{|x| x.to_s[0].ord}
  (arr[0]..arr[-1]).each do |c|
    if !arr.includes?(c)
      if L.size>5
        return c.chr
      else
        return c.chr.to_s
      end
    end
  end
end

def find_missing_letter(arr)
  i = 0
  loop do
    expected = arr[i].succ
    return expected unless arr[i+1] == expected
    i += 1
  end
end

def find_missing_letter(arr)
  arr.each_cons_pair do |x, y|
    if (z = x.bytes[0] + 1) != y.bytes[0] 
      ptr = Pointer(UInt8).new(pointerof(x).address)
      if ptr.value == x.bytes[0]
        ptr.value = z
        return x
      else
        return String.new(Bytes[z])
      end
    end
  end
end

def find_missing_letter(arr : Array(String) )
  fst_ascii = arr[0][0].ord
  
  arr[1... arr.size].each_with_index { |s, i| 
    if s[0].ord != fst_ascii + i + 1
      return (fst_ascii + i + 1).chr.to_s
    end
  }
end

def find_missing_letter(arr : Array(Char) )
  fst_ascii = arr[0].ord
  
  arr[1... arr.size].each_with_index { |s, i| 
    if s.ord != fst_ascii + i + 1
      return (fst_ascii + i + 1).chr
    end
  }
end

def find_missing_letter(arr)
  arr.each_cons(2, reuse: true) do |pair|
    a, b = pair
    if missing = compare(a, b)
      return missing
    end
  end
  
  raise "unreachable"
end

private def compare(a : String, b : String)
  compare(a.byte_at(0), b.byte_at(0)).try &.to_s
end

private def compare(a : Char, b : Char)
  compare(a.ord, b.ord)
end

private def compare(a : Int, b : Int)
  if b - a > 1
    return a.succ.chr
  end
end

def find_missing_letter(arr)
  a = arr.sort
  iter = 0
  while iter < a.size-1
    if a[iter].succ != a[iter+1]
      return a[iter].succ
    end
    iter += 1
  end
end

def approx_root(n)
  a = (n**0.5).floor; b = a+1
  (a+(n-a*a)/(b*b-a*a)).round(2)
end

def approx_root(n)
  top = 1.0
  while top * top < n
    top += 1
  end
  base = top - 1
  diff_gn = n - (base * base)
  diff_lg = (top * top) - (base * base)
  (base + (diff_gn / diff_lg)).round(2)
end

58485a43d750d23bad0000e6.body:
def fizz_buzz_cuckoo_clock(time)
  a, b = time.split(':').map(&.to_i)
  b == 30 ? "Cuckoo" : b.zero? ? ("Cuckoo " * (a % 12 == 0 ? 12 : a % 12)).strip : b % 15 == 0 ? "Fizz Buzz" : b % 5 == 0 ? "Buzz" : b % 3 == 0 ? "Fizz" : "tick"
end

def fizz_buzz_cuckoo_clock(time)
  hour = time.split(":")[0]
  min = time.split(":")[1]
  if min == "00" || min == "0"
    return ("Cuckoo " * 12).strip if hour == "00"
    return ("Cuckoo " * hour.to_i).strip if hour.to_i < 13
    return ("Cuckoo " * (hour.to_i - 12)).strip
  end
  return "Cuckoo" if min == "30"
  return "Fizz Buzz" if min.to_i % 15 == 0
  return "Fizz" if min.to_i % 3 == 0
  return "Buzz" if min.to_i % 5 == 0
  return "tick"
end

def fizz_buzz_cuckoo_clock(time)
    list = time.split(':')
    if list[1] == "00" || list[1] == "0"
        if list[0] == "00"
            return ("Cuckoo " * 12.to_i).strip
        end

        if list[0].to_i >= 12
            n = list[0].to_i - 12
            if n == 0
                return ("Cuckoo "*12).strip
            else
                return ("Cuckoo "*n).strip
            end
        end
        return ("Cuckoo "*list[0].to_i).strip
    else
        if list[1] == "30"
            return "Cuckoo"
        end
        if (list[1].to_i%3) == 0 && (list[1].to_i%5) == 0
            return "Fizz Buzz"
        end
        if (list[1].to_i%3) == 0 && (list[1].to_i%5) != 0
            return "Fizz"
        end
        if (list[1].to_i%5) == 0 && (list[1].to_i%3) !=0
            return "Buzz"
        end
        if (list[1].to_i%3) != 0 && (list[1].to_i%5) != 0
            return "tick"
        end
    end
end

def fizz_buzz_cuckoo_clock(time)
  hour, min = time.split(":")
  hour = hour.to_i % 12
  hour = 12 if hour == 0
  min = min.to_i
  if min == 0
    return ("Cuckoo " * hour).strip 
  elsif min == 30
    return "Cuckoo"
  elsif min % 3 == 0 && min % 5 == 0
    return "Fizz Buzz"
  elsif min % 3 == 0
    return "Fizz"
  elsif min % 5 == 0
    return "Buzz"
  else
    return "tick"
  end
end

def fizz_buzz_cuckoo_clock(time)
  h, m = time.split(":").map{|i| i.to_i}
  h = h == 0 || h == 24 || h == 12 ? 12 : h%12
  return ("Cuckoo " * h).strip if m == 0
  return "Cuckoo" if m == 30
  return "Fizz Buzz" if m%15 == 0
  m%3 == 0 ? "Fizz" : m%5 == 0 ? "Buzz" : "tick"
end

    when 0; 0
    when ""; 0  
    when nil; 0  
    when false; 0
    when .is_a?(Array); a.size==0? 0: 1
    else; 1
  end  
end  
def func_or(a, b) bin(a)+bin(b)>0 end
def func_xor(a,b) bin(a)+bin(b)==1 end

def force_bool(x)
  return false if x.is_a?(Array) && x.empty?
  return false if x == ""
  return false if x == 0
  !!x
end

def func_or(a,b)
  a = force_bool a
  b = force_bool b
  !(!a && !b)
end

def func_xor(a,b)
  a = force_bool a
  b = force_bool b
  a != b
end

def nand(a, b)
  return true if Array === a
  return true if Array === b
  a = false if a == 0
  b = false if b == 0
  !(a && b)
end

def func_or(a, b)
  nand(
    nand(a, a), 
    nand(b, b)
  )
end

def func_xor(a, b)
  nand(
    nand(a, nand(a, b)), 
    nand(b, nand(a, b))
  )
end

class Object
  def truthy?
    case self
    when Int32
      self != 0
    when Array
  	  !self.empty?
  	else
  	  !!self == true 
  	end
  end

  def falsey?
    !self.truthy?
  end
end

def func_or(a,b)
  case {a, b}
  when {.falsey?, .falsey?}
    false
  else
    true
  end
end

def func_xor(a,b)
  case {a, b}
  when {.truthy?, .falsey?} 
    true
  when {.falsey?, .truthy?} 
    true
  else
    false
  end
end

def to_b(x)
  return false if x.nil?
  return x if x.is_a? Bool
  return x != 0 if x.is_a? Int32
  return x.size > 0
end

def func_or(a,b)
  to_b(a)||to_b(b)
end

def func_xor(a,b)
  to_b(a)^to_b(b)
end
def cv(a) a != false && a != 0 && a != nil && a != [] of Int32 end; def func_or(a,b) cv(a) ? true : cv(b) ? true : false end; def func_xor(a,b) cv(a) != cv(b) end

  a.zip(b).map{|x,y| x+y}.sort

def chore_assignment(chores)
  assignments = [] of Int32
  chores = chores.sort()
  i = 0
  j = chores.size - 1
  while (i < j) 
    assignments.push(chores[i]+chores[j])
    i+=1
    j-=1
  assignments = assignments.sort()
  end
  assignments
end

def simplify(n)
  return Math.sqrt(n).to_i.to_s if Math.sqrt(n) % 1 == 0
  n.to_i.downto(2).each { | i |
    if Math.sqrt(i) % 1 == 0 && n % i == 0
      return "#{Math.sqrt(i).to_i} sqrt #{n.to_i // i}"
    end
  }
  "sqrt #{n}"
end

def desimplify(s)
  case s
    when /^\d+$/;     s.to_i ** 2
    when /^sqrt/;     s.to_s.split[-1].to_i
    when /^\d+ sqrt/; (s.to_s.split[0].to_i ** 2) * s.to_s.split[-1].to_i
  end
end

def find_children(dancing_brigade)
  origin_array = dancing_brigade.chars.map { |x| x.downcase }.sort
  unique = origin_array.uniq
  unique.map { |c| origin_array.index(c) }.each { |x| 
    if x
      origin_array[x] = origin_array[x].upcase
    end
  }

  origin_array.join
end

module Enumerable(T)
  def each_with_object(obj)
    each do |elem|
      yield elem, obj
    end
    obj
  end

  def tally : Hash(T, Int32)
    each_with_object(Hash(T, Int32).new) do |item, hash|
      count = hash[item]?
        if count
          hash[item] = count + 1
      else
        hash[item] = 1
      end
    end
  end
end

def find_children(dancing_brigade)
	brigade = Array(Char).new
	counts = dancing_brigade.chars.tally

	('A'..'Z').each do |parent|
		if counts.has_key?(parent)
			brigade << parent
			child = parent.downcase
			counts.has_key?(child) &&
				counts[child].times { brigade << child }
		end
	end

	return brigade.join
end

def find_children(d)
  mothers = d.delete(&.lowercase?).chars.uniq.sort
  mothers.reduce("") do |acc, m|
    ms = m.to_s
    acc += "#{ms}#{ms.downcase*d.count(ms.downcase)}"
  end
end

def find_children(dancing_brigade)
	sorted_chars = dancing_brigade.chars.sort
	result = ""
	while !sorted_chars.empty? && sorted_chars[0].uppercase?
		letter = sorted_chars.shift
		result += letter
		result += letter.downcase.to_s * sorted_chars.count { |c| c == letter.downcase }
	end
	return result
end

def find_children(dancing_brigade)
  dancing_brigade.chars.sort { |a,b|
    if a.downcase != b.downcase
      a.downcase <=> b.downcase
    else
      a.ord <=> b.ord
    end
  }.join
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms)
  band = {0=>"black", 1=>"brown", 2=>"red", 3=>"orange", 4=>"yellow", 5=>"green", 6=>"blue", 7=>"violet", 8=>"gray", 9=>"white"}
  l = ohms.includes?(".") ? ohms.sub(".", "").sub("k","00").sub("M","00000") : ohms.sub("k","000").sub("M","000000")
  k = l.split(" ")[0]
  n = Math.log10(k.to_i/k[0..1].to_i)
  [k[0],k[1],n].map{|i| band[i.to_i]}.push("gold").join(" ")
end

def rev(c)
  code = { 0 => "black", 1 => "brown", 2 => "red", 3 => "orange", 4 => "yellow",
           5 => "green", 6 => "blue", 7 => "violet", 8 => "gray", 9 => "white" }
  "#{code[c[0].to_i]} #{code[c[1].to_i]} #{code[c.size - 2]} gold"
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
  tmp = ohms_string.split(" ")[0]

  if tmp.includes?("M")
    rev (tmp.sub("M", "").to_f * 1_000_000).to_i.to_s
  elsif tmp.includes?("k")
    rev (tmp.sub("k", "").to_f * 1_000).to_i.to_s
  else
    rev tmp
  end
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
  colors = {0 => "black", 1 => "brown", 2 => "red", 3 => "orange", 4 => "yellow", 5 => "green", 6 => "blue", 7 => "violet", 8 => "gray", 9 => "white"}
  match = ohms_string.match(/(\d+\.?\d*)(\w?) ohms/)
  return nil if match.nil?
  num = match[1].to_f64
  num *= 1_000 if match[2] == "k"
  num *= 1_000_000 if match[2] == "M"
  mag = Math.log10(num).floor - 1
  digits = (num / 10 ** mag).to_i32.to_s.chars.map(&.to_i)
  "#{colors[digits[0]]} #{colors[digits[1]]} #{colors[mag]} gold"
end

def encode_resistor_colors(s)
  c = ["black", "brown", "red", "orange", "yellow", "green", "blue", "violet", "gray", "white"]
  mu = {" " => 1, "k" => 1000, "M" => 1000000}
  v, m = s.match(/([0-9.]+)(.)/).not_nil!.captures.map(&.not_nil!)
  z = (v.to_f * mu[m]).to_i.to_s.count('0')
  n = s.gsub(/[^0-9]/,"")
  "#{c[n[0].to_i]} #{n.size>1?c[n[1].to_i]: "black"} #{n.size<2||n[1]=='0'?c[z-1]: c[z]} gold"
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
    assoc = {
        0 => "black", 1 => "brown", 2 => "red", 3 => "orange", 4 => "yellow",
        5 => "green", 6 => "blue", 7 => "violet", 8 => "gray", 9 => "white"
    }
    val = ohms_string.split(" ")[0]
    if val[-1] == 'k'
        pow = 3
        val = val.chomp('k').to_f
    elsif val[-1] == 'M'
        pow = 6
        val = val.chomp('M').to_f
    else
        pow = 0
        val = val.to_f
    end
    while val < 10
        val *= 10
        pow -= 1
    end
    while val >= 100
        val /= 10
        pow += 1
    end
    val = val.to_i
    "#{assoc[val/10]} #{assoc[val%10]} #{assoc[pow]} gold"
end

enum Resistor
  Black
  Brown
  Red
  Orange
  Yellow
  Green
  Blue
  Violet
  Gray
  White
  Gold
end

class String
  def expand_number
    match(/([\d.]+)([kM])?/)
    case {$1, $2?}
    when {_, "M"}
      ($1.to_f * 1000000).to_i
    when {_, "k"}
      ($1.to_f * 1000).to_i
    else
      $1.to_i
    end.to_s
  end
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
  ohms_string.chomp(" ohms")
    .expand_number
    .match(/(\d{2,}?)(0+)?$/)
  $1.chars
    .map {|c| Resistor.new(c.to_i) }
    .+([Resistor.new($2?.try &.size || 0), Resistor::Gold])
    .join(" ").downcase
end

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
  ohms_string = ohms_string.split[0]
  mult = ohms_string.includes?("M") ? 1000000 : ohms_string.includes?("k") ? 1000 : 1
  mult /= 10 if ohms_string.includes?(".")
  amount = ohms_string.gsub(/\D+/, "").to_f * mult
  colors = {0 => "black", 1 => "brown", 2 => "red", 3 => "orange", 4 => "yellow", 5 => "green", 6 => "blue", 7 => "violet", 8 => "gray", 9 => "white"}
  d1 = amount.to_s.chars[0].to_i
  d2 = amount.to_s.chars[1].to_i
  [colors[d1], colors[d2], colors[Math.log10(amount / (d1 * 10 + d2)).to_i], "gold"].join(" ")
end

COLORS = %w{black brown red orange yellow green blue violet gray white}

def encode_resistor_colors(ohms_string)
  v = ohms_string.split[0]
  unit = 1
  case v[-1]
  when 'k'
    v = v[0, v.size - 1]
    unit = 1000
  when 'M'
    v = v[0, v.size - 1]
    unit = 1000000
  end
  n = v.to_f
  val = n * unit
  digits = if val < 10
             "0#{val}"
           else
             "#{val}"[0, 2]
           end
  rep = [] of String
  digits.each_char do |c|
    rep << COLORS[c.to_i]
  end
  # mult
  p = Math.log(val/digits.to_f, 10).round.to_i
  rep << COLORS[p]
  rep << "gold"
  rep.join(" ")
end

DIGITS = %w(
  black
  brown
  red
  orange
  yellow
  green
  blue
  violet
  gray
  white
)

MULTIPLIERS = %w(
  black
  brown
  red
  orange
  yellow
  green
  blue
  violet
  gray
  white
  pink
  silver
  gold
)

def encode_resistor_colors(str)
  x, _ = str.split
  value = x.sub(/[kM]/, "").to_f
  value *= 1000 if x[-1] == 'k'
  value *= 1000000 if x[-1] == 'M'
  exponent = 0
  while value >= 100
    exponent += 1
    value /= 10
  end
  while value < 10
    exponent -= 1
    value *= 10
  end
  x1 = value.to_i / 10
  x2 = value.to_i % 10
  [DIGITS[x1], DIGITS[x2], MULTIPLIERS[exponent], "gold"].join(' ')
end

def reduce_by_rules(ns, rs)
  nc = ns.size
  rc = rs.size
  n = rs[0].call(ns[0], ns[1])
  i = 2
  while i < nc
    n = rs[(i - 1) % rc].call(n, ns[i])
    i += 1
  end
  n
end

def reduce_by_rules(array, rules)
  a=array[0..-1]
  i=0
  l=rules.size
  while a.size>1
    tmp=rules[i%l].call(a[0],a[1])
    i+=1
    a.shift
    a[0]=tmp
  end
  a.pop
end
def reduce_by_rules(a,r) i=-1; a.reduce{|a,b| i=(i+1) % r.size; r[i].call(a,b)} end

class Primes
  @@primes=[2,3,5,7]
  
  def self.primes
    @@primes
  end
  
  def self.is_prime(n)
    return false if n<2
    i=0; limit=(n**0.5).to_i;
    while true
      self.expand_primes(@@primes[i-1]) if i>=@@primes.size
      break if @@primes[i]>limit
      return false if (n % @@primes[i])==0
      i+=1
    end
    return true
  end
  
  def self.expand_primes(n)
    next_n=(n+1)%6!=0 ? n+4 : n+2;
    if self.is_prime(next_n)
      @@primes+=[next_n]
    else self.expand_primes(next_n) end
  end
end

require "set"

class Primes
  @@primes = [2, 3, 5, 7, 11]
  @@not_primes = Set{0, 1, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10}

  def self.primes
    @@primes
  end

  def self.is_prime(n)
    puts "is_prime(#{n})"
    nn = n.abs
    return false if @@not_primes.includes?(nn)
    return true if @@primes.includes?(nn)
    self.compute(nn)
  end

  def self.compute(n)
    is_prime = true
    c = 2
    while n / c >= c
      if n % c == 0
        @@not_primes << n
        is_prime = false
        break
      end
      if c == 2
        c = 3
      else
        c += 2
      end
    end
    if is_prime
      @@primes << n
    end
    is_prime
  end
end


def test_lenR(n, l)

end

class Primes
  @@primes = [2,3,5,7]
  
  def self.primes
    @@primes
  end
  
  def self.is_prime(n)
    return false if n<2
    i=0
    k=(n**0.5).round.to_i
    while true
      self.expand_primes(@@primes[i-1]) if i>=@@primes.size
      break if @@primes[i]>k
      return false if (n % @@primes[i])==0
      i+=1
    end
    true
  end
  
  def self.expand_primes(n)
    m = n+2
    if self.is_prime(m)
      @@primes += [m]
    else 
      self.expand_primes(m) 
    end
  end
end

def box(n)
  res = [] of String
  (0...n).each{|i|
    s = ""
    (0...n).each{|j|
      if i==0 || i+1==n || j==0 || j+1==n
        s += "-"
      else
        s += " "
      end
    }
    res << s
  }
  res
end

def box(n)
  f = [(1..n).map{|i|'-'}.join]
  (0..n-3).each do |i|
    f.push("-" + (0..n-3).map{|j|" "}.join + "-")
  end
  f + [f[0]]
end

def median(array)
  if array.size.even?
    array.sort[array.size // 2 - 1..array.size // 2].sum / 2
  else
    array.sort[array.size // 2]
  end
end

def median(array)
  sorted = array.sort
  n = array.size
  i = (n/2).to_i
  a,b = [sorted[i], sorted[n-i-1]]
  (a+b)/2
end

def median(a)
  n = (a.sort!.size / 2).to_i
  a.size % 2 == 1 ? a[n] : (a[n-1] + a[n]) / 2
end

def median(a)
  a=a.sort
  l=a.size
  m=l>>1
  (a[m]+(a[m-((l&1)^1)]))/2
end

def median(array)
  a = array.sort
  a.size.odd? ? a[a.size // 2] : (a[a.size // 2] + a[(a.size // 2) - 1]) / 2.0
end

def rotate(str)
    i = 0
    res = [] of String
    res.push(str)
    while i < str.size
        res.push(rt(res[-1]))
        i += 1
    end
    res.shift
    res
end

    str.split("").rotate.join("")
end

def convert_c_f(num, scale="c")
  case scale
  when "c"
    ((num - 32) * 5 / 9.0).round(1)
  when "f"
    ((num * 9 / 5.0) + 32).round(1)
  else
    raise "FAIL"
  end
end

def convert_c_f(num, scale = "c")

end

     when "c"; 5.0/9*(num-32)
     when "f"; 9.0/5*num+32
     else raise "err_unit"
  end).round 1
end

def closest(strng)
    if (strng == "") 
      return [] of Array(Int32)
    end
    nums = strng.split()
    l = [] of Array(Int32)
    i = 0
    while (i < nums.size)
        n = nums[i]
        l += [[n.chars.map{|x| x.to_i}.reduce(0){ |sum, x| sum + x }, i, n.to_i]]
        i += 1
    end
    arr = l.sort()
    t = (1..arr.size-1).map { |i| [arr[i][0]-arr[i-1][0], i] }.min[1]
    [arr[t - 1], arr[t]]
end

def weight(n)
  w = 0
  while n > 0
    w += n % 10
    n /= 10
  end
  w
end

def closest(strng)
  return [] of Array(Int32) if strng == ""
  i = -1
  nums = strng.split(/\s+/).map { | sn |
    n = sn.to_i
    [weight(n), i += 1, n]
  }.sort
  idx, wd = 0, 0
  nums[0...-1].each_with_index do | (w, i, n), j |
    next unless j == 0 || nums[j + 1][0] - w < wd
    wd = nums[j + 1][0] - w
    idx = j
  end
  nums[idx,2]
end

def closest(strng)
  strng.split
    .map_with_index{|a, i|[a.chars.map(&.to_i).reduce(0){|acc, i|acc + i}, i, a.to_i]}
    .sort
    .each_cons(2).to_a
    .min_by?{|a|[a[1][0] - a[0][0]]} || [] of Int32
end

5869848f2d52095be20001d1.body:
struct CatPosition
  property x, y
  
  def initialize(@x : Int32, @y : Int32)
  end
end

def peaceful_yard(yard, min_distance)
  cats_positions = find_cats(yard)
  cats_positions.each_with_index do |cat1_position, cat1_index|
    (cat1_index + 1..cats_positions.size - 1).each do |cat2_index|
      return false unless safe_distance?(cat1_position, cats_positions[cat2_index], min_distance)
    end
  end
  
  return true
end

def safe_distance?(position1, position2, min_safe_distance)
  distance = measure_distance(position1, position2)
  
  return distance >= min_safe_distance
end

def find_cats(yard)
  cats_positions = Array(CatPosition).new

  yard.each_with_index do |yard_row, y|
    yard_row.chars.each_with_index do |field, x|
      cats_positions << CatPosition.new(x, y) if field != '-'
    end
  end
  
  cats_positions
end

def measure_distance(position1, position2)
  ((position1.x - position2.x).abs ** 2 + (position1.y - position2.y).abs ** 2) ** 0.5
end

def peaceful_yard(yard, min_distance)
  cats = [] of Array(Int32)
  yard.each_with_index do |line, row|
    0.upto(line.size - 1) do |col|
      if line[col] != '-'
        cats.push([row, col])
      end
    end
  end

  0.upto(cats.size - 2) do |i|
    (i + 1).upto(cats.size - 1) do |j|
      if Math.hypot(cats[i][0] - cats[j][0], cats[i][1] - cats[j][1]) < min_distance
        return false
      end
    end
  end

  return true
end

MONTHS = {
  "Jan" => 1,
  "Feb" => 2,
  "Mar" => 3,
  "Apr" => 4,
  "May" => 5,
  "Jun" => 6,
  "Jul" => 7,
  "Aug" => 8,
  "Sep" => 9,
  "Oct" => 10,
  "Nov" => 11,
  "Dec" => 12,  
}

def driver(data)
  firstname, midname, surname, dob, gender = data
  female = (gender == "F")
  day, mon, year = dob.split("-")
  month = MONTHS[mon[0,3]]
  month += 50 if female
  [
    (surname.upcase + "99999")[0,5],
    year.to_s[2,1],
    "%02d" % month,
    day,
    year.to_s[3,1],
    firstname[0,1],
    (midname.size > 1) ? midname[0,1] : "9",
    "9",
    "AA",
  ].join
end

def driver(data)
  months = ["Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec"]
  surname = (data[2].upcase + "99999")[0...5]
  y = data[3][-2]
  m = ("00" + ((months.index(data[3][3..5]) || 0) + 1).to_s)[-2..-1]
  m = data[4] == "M" ? m : (m[0].to_i + 5).to_s + m[1].to_s
  day = data[3][0...2]
  yd = data[3][-1].to_s
  initials = data[0][0].to_s + (data[1].size == 0 ? "9" : data[1][0].to_s)
  return "#{surname}#{y}#{m}#{day}#{yd}#{initials}9AA"
end

def combat(health, damage)
  if health - damage > 0
    health - damage
  else
    0
  end
end

enum DamageType
  Generic
  Slash
  Gun
  Magic
  Energy
end

struct Damage
  getter value : Int32
  getter type : DamageType

  def initialize(@value, @type)
  end
end

class Player
  @health : Int32
  
  def health
    @health
  end
  
  def set_health(new_health : Int32)
    @health = Math.max(new_health, 0)
  end
  
  def apply_damage(damage : Damage)
    set_health(@health - damage.value)
  end
  
  def initialize(@health)
  end
end

def combat(health, damage)
  player = Player.new(health)
  player.apply_damage(Damage.new(damage, DamageType::Generic))
  player.health
end
def combat(health, damage) damage > health ? 0 : health - damage end

  return 0 if a > b

  end
  n

def sequence_sum(begin_number, end_number, step)
  return 0 if begin_number > end_number
  
  res = begin_number
  added_element = res + step
  
  while added_element <= end_number
    res += added_element
    added_element += step
  end
  
  return res
end

def sequence_sum(begin_number, end_number, step)
  sum, k = 0, begin_number
  while k <= end_number
    sum += k
    k += step
  end
  sum
end

def sequence_sum(begin_number, end_number, step)
  s = 0
  (begin_number..end_number).step(step) do |i|
    s += i
  end
  s
end

GRAVITY_ACC = 9.81 * 3.6 * 60.0                   
DRAG = 60.0 * 0.3 / 3.6                           
DELTA_T = 1.0/60.0                                
D_WATTS = 0.5                                     
G_THRUST = 60 * 3.6 * 3.6                         
MASS = 80                                         
WATTS0 = 225   
def temps(v0, slope, d_tot)   
    t = 0.0          
    d = 0.0         
    v = v0           
    gamma = 0.0      
    watts = WATTS0   
    slopeGravityAcc = -GRAVITY_ACC * Math.sin(Math.atan(slope / 100.0))
    while (d <= d_tot)
        t += DELTA_T   
        watts -= D_WATTS * DELTA_T  
        gamma = slopeGravityAcc - DRAG * v.abs * v.abs / MASS 
        if ((watts > 0.0) && (v > 0.0))
            gamma += G_THRUST * watts / (v * MASS)
        end   
        if (gamma.abs <= 1e-5)
            gamma = 0.0
        else
            v += gamma * DELTA_T
        end  
        d +=  v  * DELTA_T / 60.0  
        if (v - 3.0 <= 1e-2)  
            return -1
        end
    end 
    t.round
end

end

  from, to, step = from.to_i64, to.to_i64, step.to_i64

end

end

def phone_call(min1, min2_10, min11, s)
 if s < min1
    return 0
  end
  s -= min1
  t = 1
  c = 0
  while s >= min2_10
      s -= min2_10
      t += 1
      c += 1
      if c > 8
        break
      end
  end
  t + (c != 9 ? 0 : s // min11)
end

def phone_call(min1, min2_10, min11, s)
  return 0 if s < min1
  s -= min1
  return s // min2_10 + 1 if s < min2_10 * 9
  s -= min2_10 * 9
  s // min11 + 10
end

def phone_call(min1, min2_10, min11, s)
  mins = 0
  used = 0
  left = s
  current_money_incrementer = min1
  while used < s && (left - current_money_incrementer) >= 0
    mins += 1
    current_money_incrementer = min2_10 if mins >= 2 && mins <= 10
    current_money_incrementer = min11 if mins > 10
    used += current_money_incrementer
    left -= current_money_incrementer
  end
  mins
end

def phone_call(min1, min2_10, min11, s)
  return 0 if s < min1
  o = 1*min1
  return 1 if s-o <= 0
  t, m = 9*min2_10, (s-o)/min2_10
  m < 9 ? 1+m : 10+(s-o-t)/min11
end

def knapsack_light(value1,weight1,value2,weight2,max_w)
  if weight1 + weight2 <= max_w
      return value1 + value2
   elsif weight1 <= max_w && weight2 <= max_w
     return [value1, value2].max
   elsif weight1 > max_w && weight2 > max_w
     return 0
   elsif weight1 <= max_w && weight2 >= max_w
     return value1
   else
     return value2
   end
end

def knapsack_light(v1,w1,v2,w2,mw)
  return 0 if w1 > mw && w2 > mw
  return w1 + w2 > mw ? [v1,v2].max : [v1,v2].sum if w1 <= mw && w2 <= mw
  w1 <= mw && w2 >= mw ? v1 : v2
end

def group(arr)

  # Empty arrays should be [] of Int32, but the tests ask for [] of Array(Int32)
  arr = arr.as?(Array(Int32))
  return [] of Array(Int32) if !arr || arr.empty?

def bits_battle(numbers)
  m = 0
  numbers.each{|n|
    next if n == 0
    m += count(n, n%2) if n%2==1
    m -= count(n, n%2) if n%2==0
  }
  m == 0 ? "tie" 
    : m > 0 ? "odds win"
    : "evens win"
end

def count(n, d)
  m = 0
  while n != 0
    m += 1 if n%2==d
    n >>= 1
  end
  m

def bits_battle(numbers)
  odd = numbers.select(&.odd?).map{|x| x.to_s(2)}.join.count('1')
  even = numbers.select{|x| x.even? && x != 0}.map{|x| x.to_s(2)}.join.count('0')
  odd > even ? "odds win" : even > odd ? "evens win" : "tie"
end

def bits_battle(numbers)
  odd = numbers.select(&.odd?).map{|n| n.to_s(2) }.join.count("1")
  even = numbers.select(&.even?).reject(&.zero?).map{|n| n.to_s(2) }.join.count("0")
  if odd > even
    "odds win"
  elsif odd == even
    "tie"
  else
    "evens win"
  end
end

def bits_battle(numbers)
  od, ev = 0, 0
  numbers.each do |i|
    next if i == 0
    s = i.to_s(2)
    i.odd? ? (od += s.count('1')) : (ev += s.count('0'))
  end
  od > ev ? "odds win" : ev > od ? "evens win" : "tie"
end

def bits_battle(numbers)
  n=numbers.map{|x| x== 0 ? 0 : x&1==1 ? x.to_s(2).count("1") : -x.to_s(2).count("0")}.sum
  n == 0 ? "tie" : n<0 ? "evens win" : "odds win"
end

def bits_battle(numbers)
  o = numbers.each.select(&.odd?).sum(&.popcount)
  e = numbers.each.select(&.even?).sum{ |x| (~x).popcount - x.leading_zeros_count }
  case o <=> e
    when .>(0) then "odds win"
    when .<(0) then "evens win"
    else "tie"
  end
end

def bits_war(numbers)
  odds = numbers.select{|x| x.abs.odd?}.map{|x| x.abs.to_s(2).count("1") * (x < 0 ? -1 : 1)}.sum
  evens = numbers.select{|x| x.abs.even?}.map{|x| x.abs.to_s(2).count("1") * (x < 0 ? -1 : 1)}.sum
  odds == evens ? "tie" : "#{odds > evens ? "odd" : "even"}s win"
end

def sign(n)
  n == 0 ? 0 : n > 0 ? 1 : -1
end
def bits_war(numbers)
  res=numbers.map{|x| sign(x)*x.to_s(2).count("1") * (x.odd? ? 1 : -1)}.sum
  res == 0 ? "tie" : res < 0 ? "evens win" : "odds win"
end

def bits_war(numbers)
  m = 0
  numbers.each{|n|
    next if n == 0
    if (n > 0) ^ (n % 2 != 0)
      m -= count(n)
    else
      m += count(n)
    end
  }
  m == 0 ? "tie" 
    : m > 0 ? "odds win"
    : "evens win"
end

def count(n)
  m = 0
  n = -n if n < 0
  while n != 0
    m += 1 if n%2!=0
    n >>= 1
  end
  m
end
def bits_war(n) s=n.reduce(0){|a,b| a+b.to_s(2).count("1")*(-1)**(b%2)*(b<0 ? -1 : 1)}; s>0 ? "evens win" : s<0 ? "odds win" : "tie" end

def possibilities(string)
  return [string] if !string.includes?("?")
  lst = [] of String
  undone = [] of String
  if /\?/ === string 
    undone << string
  end
  while !undone.empty?
    s = undone.pop()
    (0..1).each do |i|
      st = s.sub(/\?/, i.to_s)
      if /\?/ === st
        undone << st
      else
        lst << st
      end
    end
  end
  lst
end

def possibilities(s)
  c=s.count('?')
  a=[s]
  (0..c-1).each do
    tmp=[] of String
    a.each do |e|
      tmp.push(e.sub(/\?/,'1'))
      tmp.push(e.sub(/\?/,'0'))
    end
    a=tmp
  end
  a
end

def possibilities(string)
  idx = string.index('?')
  return [string] unless idx
  possibilities(string.sub idx, '0') + possibilities(string.sub idx, '1')
end

def possibilities( string ) 
  poss = possibilities_chars(string.chars)
  poss.map { |pos| pos.join("") }
end

def possibilities_chars(chars) : Array(Array(Char))
  idx = chars.index('?')
  # puts "chars=#{chars} idx=#{idx}"
  
  if idx.nil?
    [ chars ]
  else
    i = idx.not_nil!
    pos_rec = possibilities_chars( chars[(i+1)...chars.size] )
    
    h0 = pos_rec.map { |pos| chars[0...i] + ['0'] + pos }
    h1 = pos_rec.map { |pos| chars[0...i] + ['1'] + pos } 
    h0 + h1
  end
end

def possibilities(string)
  string
  .chars
  .map { |c|
    case c
    when '?'
      ["0", "1"]
    else 
      [c.to_s]
    end
  }
  .reduce { |base,new|
    base.flat_map { |b|
      new.flat_map { |n|
        [b + n]
      }
    }
  }
end

def possibilities(string)
  return [ string ] unless string =~ /\?/
  pre, post = $~.pre_match, $~.post_match
  [0, 1].flat_map do | dig |
    possibilities(post).map { | pp | "#{pre}#{dig}#{pp}" }
  end
end

def possibilities(string : String) : Array(String)
  return [] of String if string.empty?
  return ["0", "1"] if string == '?'
  c = string.count('?')
  return [string] if c == 0
  a, b = string.sub('?', '0'), string.sub('?', '1')
  return [a, b] if c == 1
  possibilities(a) + possibilities(b)
end

def chessboard_cell_color(cell1, cell2)
  l1 = cell1[0].bytes()[0]-1
  l2 = cell2[0].bytes()[0]-1
  n1 = cell1[1].bytes()[0]+0
  n2 = cell2[1].bytes()[0]+0

  if ((l1+n1)%2) == ((l2+n2)%2)
    return true
  else
    return false
  end
end

def chessboard_cell_color(cell1, cell2)
  abc = "_ABCDEFGH"
  check = ->(cell : String) {
    c0 = abc.index(cell[0]).not_nil!
    c1 = cell[1].not_nil!.to_i
    (c0.odd? && c1.odd?) || (c0.even? && c1.even?) ? "black" : "white"
  }
  return true if check.call(cell1) == "black" && check.call(cell2) == "black"
  return true if check.call(cell1) == "white" && check.call(cell2) == "white"
  return false
end

def is_black(c) (c[0].ord+c[1].to_i)%2 end;
def chessboard_cell_color(c1, c2) is_black(c1)==is_black(c2) end

DICT = {')' => '(', ']' => '[', '}' => '{'}

def braces_status(s)
  stack = [] of Char
  s.chars.each do |x|
    if x == '(' || x == '[' || x == '{'
      stack << x
    end
    if x == ')' || x == ']' || x == '}'
      return false if stack.empty?
      cmp = stack.pop()
      return false if  DICT[x] != cmp
    end
  end
  stack.empty?
end

def braces_status(s)
  s.each_char.with_object([] of Char) do |x, s|
    case x
      when '(' then s << ')'
      when '[' then s << ']'
      when '{' then s << '}'
      else
        if "])}".includes?(x) && (s.empty? || s.pop != x); return false end
    end
    puts(s)
  end.empty?
end
def braces_status(s) n=s.gsub(/[^\{\}\[\](\)]/,"").gsub(/(\(\))|(\[\])|(\{\})/,""); n.inspect != s.inspect ? braces_status(n) : n=="" end

def missing_alphabets(s)
  char_counts = Hash(Char, Int32).new
  ('a'..'z').each do |c|
    char_counts[c] = s.count(c)
  end
  max_count = char_counts.values.max
  String.build do |str|
    char_counts.each do |c, count|
      (max_count - count).times do
        str << c
      end
    end
  end
end

end

    times = (arr.size / chunk_size.to_f).ceil
    (1..times).reduce([] of Array(Int32)) { |ac, n|

  end
  parts
end

def cut_the_ropes(arr)
  l=arr.size
  if l==0
    return [] of Int32
  end
  res=[l]

  i=0
  while true

def withdraw(n)
  c=0
  h=0
  if (n/10)%2==1
    c+=1
    n-=50
    end
  h=(n/100).floor
  n%=100
  f=(n/100).floor
  n%=100
  [h,c,(n/20).floor]
end

# non-optimal solution, when n is not easy solution (only 100/50/20 bills) it subtract the value of the 
# smallest bill and repeats until an easy solution is found. Then it converts the smaller bills to larger ones if the value is a multiple
def withdraw(n)
  # puts "n:#{n}"
  result = [0, 0, 0]

  while n > 0
    x = whole_multiple(n)
    if x
      result = result.zip(x).flat_map { |a, b| a + b }
      break
    end

    # subtract smallest denomination
    result[2] += 1
    n -= 20
  end
  convert_to_larger_bills result

  result
end

def convert_to_larger_bills(arr)
  # divide smaller bills into larger ones
  if arr[2] >= 5
    arr[1] += (arr[2] / 5) * 2 # 5x20 = 100 -> 2 * 50
    arr[2] %= 5
  end
  if arr[1] >= 2
    arr[0] += arr[1] / 2
    arr[1] %= 2
  end
end

def whole_multiple(n)
  return [n/100, 0, 0] if n % 100 == 0
  return [0, n/50, 0] if n % 50 == 0
  return [0, 0, n/20] if n % 20 == 0
end

def sum_groups(arr)
  
  r = Array(Int32).new
  m = 0
  
  (0...arr.size).each{|i|
    m += arr[i]
    if i+1 >= arr.size || arr[i]%2 != arr[i+1]%2
      r << m
      m = 0
    end
  }

  r.size == arr.size ? r.size : sum_groups(r)
  
end

def sum_groups(arr)
  if arr.size<2
    return arr.size
  end
  while true
    flag=false
    l=arr.size
    a=[] of Int32
    tmp=arr[0]
    p=tmp%2
    (1..l-1).each do |i|
      n=arr[i]
      k=n%2
      if k == p
        flag=true
        tmp+=n
      else
        a.push(tmp)
        p=k
        tmp=n
      end
    end
    a.push(tmp)
    if !flag || a.size==1
      return a.size
    end
    arr=a
   end
end

def sum_groups(xs : Enumerable(T)) forall T
  ys = [] of T
  while ys.size != xs.size
    ys, xs = xs, xs.chunk{ |x| x % 2 == 0 }.map{ |(_, g)| g.sum }.to_a
  end
  xs.size
end

def sum_groups(xs : Array(T)) forall T
  ys = [] of T
  while ys.size != xs.size
    ys, xs = xs, xs.chunk{ |x| x % 2 == 0 }.map{ |(_, g)| g.sum }.to_a
  end
  xs.size
end

def sum_groups(arr) m=arr[1...arr.size].reduce({"res" => [arr[0]], "odd" => [arr[0]%2]}){|a,b| [b%2]==a["odd"] ? {"res" => a["res"][0...a["res"].size-1]+[a["res"][-1]+b], "odd" => a["odd"]} : {"res" => a["res"]+[b], "odd" => [b%2]}}; res=m["res"]; res==arr ? res.size : sum_groups(res) end

BALL_VALUES = {
  "R" => 1, "Y" => 2, "G" => 3, "Bn" => 4, "Be" => 5, "P" => 6, "Bk" => 7
}

def frame(balls : String) : Int32 | String
  return "Foul" if balls.includes?('W')
  s = balls.scan(/([A-Z][a-z]?)([0-9]*)/).sum do |(_, c, n)|
    return "invalid data" if (v = BALL_VALUES[c]?).nil?
    (n.empty? ? 1 : n.to_i) * v
  end
  s <= 147 ? s : "invalid data"
end

def frame(balls)
  blz = {"R" => 1, "Y" => 2, "G" => 3, "Bn" => 4, "Be" => 5, "P" => 6, "Bk" => 7}
  return "Foul" if balls.includes? "W"
  c = [] of Array(String)
  while match = /([A-Z][a-z]?)(\d*)/.match(balls)
    c << [match[1], match[2]]
    balls = match.post_match
  end
  s = c.map{|x| blz[x[0].to_s].to_i*(x[1] == "" ? 1 : x[1].to_i)}.sum
  s > 147 ? "invalid data" : s
end

def folding(a, b)
  if a > b
    1 + folding(a - b, b)
  elsif a < b
    1 + folding(b - a, a)
  else 
    1
  end
end

def folding(a,b)
  count = 0
  return _folding(a, b, count)
end

def _folding(a, b, count)
  max, min = [a, b].max, [a, b].min
  c = max - min
  count += 1
  if c == min
    count + 1 # Count the last square
  else
    _folding(c, min, count)
  end
end

def folding(a,b)
  r=1
  while a != b
    t = a-b
    b,a = [t,b].sort
    r+=1
  end
  r
end

def socialist_distribution(pop, min)
  # Is it even feasible
  return [] of Int32 if pop.sum < min*pop.size
  tax = 0
  # First spend
  pop = pop.map do |x|
    if x < min
      tax += (min - x)
      min
    else
      x
    end  
  end
  # Then tax
  while tax > 0
    i = pop.index(pop.max).not_nil!
    pop[i] -= 1
    tax -= 1
  end
  pop
end

def socialist_distribution(p,m) q=p.dup; min,max=q.min,q.max; imin,imax=q.index(min),q.index(max); q[imin]+=1 if imin; q[imax]-=1 if imax; p.size==0 || p.reduce(0){|a,b| a+b} / p.size<m ? [] of Int32 : p.all?{|a| m<=a} ? p : socialist_distribution(q,m) end

def socialist_distribution(p,m) q=p.dup; min,max=q.min,q.max; imin,imax=q.index(min),q.index(max); q[imin]+=1 if imin; q[imax]-=1 if imax; p.size==0 || p.reduce(0){|a,b| a+b} / p.size<m ? [] of Int32 : p.all?{|a| m<=a} ? p : socialist_distribution(q,m) end

def reverse_alternate(s)
  if s == ""
    return s
  end
  a = 0
  b = [""]
  s.split.each do |i|
      if a == 1
          a -= 1
          b.push(i.reverse)
      else
          a += 1
          b.push(i)
      end
  end
  b.join(' ')[1..-1]
end

def simple_assembler(program : Array(String)) : Hash(String, Int32)
  registers = {} of String => Int32
  program_index = 0

  while program_index < program.size
    instruction = program[program_index].split
    command, register, value = instruction[0], instruction[1], instruction[2]? || "0"

    case command
    when "mov"
      registers[register] = value.to_i? || registers[value]? || registers[register]
    when "inc"
      registers[register] += 1
    when "dec"
      registers[register] -= 1
    when "jnz"
      next program_index += value.to_i if (registers.fetch(register, nil) || value.to_i) != 0
    end

    program_index += 1
  end

  registers
end

def simple_assembler(program : Array(String))
  registers = Hash(String, Int32).new
  prog = program.map(&.split(" "))

  i = 0
  while i < prog.size
    ins : String = prog[i][0]
    reg = prog[i][1]

    case ins
    when "mov"
      registers[reg] = registers[prog[i][2]]? || (prog[i][2]).to_i
    when "inc"
      registers[reg] += 1
    when "dec"
      registers[reg] -= 1
    when "jnz"
      reg = registers[reg]? || reg.to_i
      if reg != 0
        i += (registers[prog[i][2]]? || (prog[i][2]).to_i)
        next
      else
        i += 1
        next
      end
    end
    i += 1
  end

  registers
end

def val(h, a)
  h.has_key?(a) ? h[a] : a.to_i
end

def simple_assembler(program)
  res = {} of String => Int32
  pc = 0
  while program[pc]?
    case program[pc]
    when /\Amov +(\w+) +(-?\w+)\z/
      res[$1] = val(res, $2)
    when /\Ainc +(\w+)\z/
      res[$1] += 1
    when /\Adec +(\w+)\z/
      res[$1] -= 1
    when /\Ajnz +(-?\w+) +(-?\w+)\z/
      pc += val(res, $2) - 1 if val(res, $1) != 0
    else
      raise "Bullshit instruction ##{pc}: #{program[pc]}"
    end
    pc += 1
  end
  res
end

def simple_assembler(program : Array(String)) : Hash(String, Int32)
  memory = {} of String => Int32
  program_index = 0

  while program_index < program.size
    instruction = program[program_index].split
    command, register, value = instruction[0], instruction[1], instruction[2]? || "0"

    case command
    when "mov"
      memory[register] = value.to_i? || memory[value]? || memory[register]
    when "inc"
      memory[register] += 1
    when "dec"
      memory[register] -= 1
    when "jnz"
      next program_index += value.to_i if (memory.fetch(register, nil) || value.to_i) != 0
    end

    program_index += 1
  end
